00050 #pragma once
00051 
00052 #include "semaphore.h"
00053 #include "topic.h"

00055 
00056 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00057 namespace RODOS {
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 class Putter;
00061 
00062 /**
00063 * @class Subscriber
00064 * @brief Subscriber to receive messages
00065 *
00066 *  The middleware communication is based on the publisher/subscriber protocol.
00067 *  Publishers make messages public under a given topic.
00068 *  Subscribers to a given topic get all messages which are published
00069 *  under the given topic.
00070 *  To establish a transfer path, both:
00071 *  publisher and subscriber have to share the same topic.
00072 *
00073 * Each subscriber has a reference to the associated topic and a putter
00074 * to store messages.
00075 * All subscribers are registered in a list.
00076 * Each time a messages is published the list of all subscriber will be search and
00077 * for each subscriber where the topic matches the associated putter will be called
00078 * to store a copy of the published message.
00079 */
00080 
00081 class NetMsgInfo {
00082 public:
00083     int32_t senderNode; ///< Node ID of sending instance of RODOS
00084     int64_t sentTime;   ///< Time in localTime units 
00085     uint32_t senderThreadId;
00086     uint32_t linkId;
00087 };
00088 
00089 
00090 class Subscriber : public ListElement {
00091 
00092     friend class TopicInterface;
00093     friend class TopicReporter;
00094     friend void initSystem();
00095 
00096 public:
00097     /// Reference to a topic to which the subscriber listens.
00098     TopicInterface& topicInterface;
00099 
00100     /// Reference to the associated handler of a message received.
00101     Putter* receiver;
00102 
00103 protected:
00104     /// Flag to indicate if the subscriber broadcasts a message internally or externally
00105     bool isAGateway;
00106     /// Flag to activate or deactivate the subscriber
00107     bool isEnabled;
00108     /// List of all subscribers in the system
00109     static List subscriberList;
00110 
00111     Semaphore protector;
00112     /// DEPRECATED! DO not use anymore!
00113     virtual long put(const long topicId, const long len, const void* data, long linkId);
00114     /// Default function: forward the message and invoke the receiver (putter). It locks the semaphore protector
00115     virtual long put(const long topicId, const long len, const void* data, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo);
00116 
00117     /// do not locks any semaphore. Do not call any thread funcion
00118     /// default function resumes the associated thread (if defiend) if it is waiting for it
00119     virtual void putFromInterrupt(const long topicId, const void* any, int len = 0);
00120 
00121 
00122 public:
00123 
00124     /** At creation time a connection to the corresponding topic
00125      * and putter (receiver) has to be done.
00126      * Subscriber my be "Normal" message receiver or may be Gateways.
00127      * Gatewayes are interfaces to other memory spaces and nodes, e.g.
00128      * going throug a network. Gateways just forward messages to other nodes.
00129      *
00130      * The parameter name is only used for debug purposes, to see which subscriber is
00131      * attached to which topic. Using names you can recognise present subscribers in listings.
00132      *
00133      * @param topic reference to the topic to which the owner will be subscribed
00134      * @param putter reference to a putter receiving messages from the topic subscribed
00135      * @param name name is used only for debug purposes, sing it one can recognise Threads.
00136      * @param isAGatewayParam : gateways get from all topics and they decide to forward or not
00137      */
00138     Subscriber(TopicInterface &topic, Putter& receiver, const char* name = "anonymSubscriber", bool isAGatewayParam=false);
00139 
00140     /**
00141       * Simple subscriber has no ssociated receiver (nor thread nor putter), they just (have to)
00142       * redifine the put method
00143       */
00144     Subscriber(TopicInterface &topic, const char* name = "anonymThreadSubscriber");
00145 
00146     /// Destructor, should not be called in nominal operation.
00147     virtual ~Subscriber() { ERROR("Subscriber deleted"); }
00148 
00149     /** returns true if InputPort is enabled and wants to receive messages for
00150     *   given topicId
00151     */
00152     // virtual bool wants(const long topicId) const;
00153 
00154     /**
00155      * @return enabled == true -> receive all messages to the given ServiceId,
00156     *    else ignore them
00157     */
00158     void enable(bool onOff = true);
00159 
00160     /** Check whether the current subscriber is a gateway,
00161      * hence connects to the network.
00162      * @return if true -> message is sent to the network, false -> is send locally
00163      */
00164     bool isGateway() const;
00165 
00166 };
00167 
00168 
00169 /** Simple Subscriver interface for userd ************/
00170 
00171 template <class Type>
00172 class SubscriberReceiver : public Subscriber {
00173     void (*receiver)(Type &msg); // a functio to be called for each message (optional)
00174 
00175 public:
00176     SubscriberReceiver(TopicInterface &topic, const char* name = "anonymSubscriber") :
00177         Subscriber(topic, name) {
00178         receiver = 0;
00179     }
00180     SubscriberReceiver(TopicInterface &topic,  void (*funcPtr)(Type&), const char* name = "anonymSubscriber") :
00181         Subscriber(topic, name) {
00182         receiver = funcPtr;
00183     }
00184 
00185     virtual void put(Type &msg) {if(receiver) (*receiver)(msg); };
00186     virtual void put(Type &msg, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo) {put(msg);};
00187     long put(const long topicId, const long len, const void* data, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo) { 
00188         put(*(Type*)data,netMsgInfo);
00189         return 1;
00190     }
00191 };
